name: Hades Canyon (Dante's Variation)
description:
Introduction

Be prepared to slide down sections of scree before reaching the first rappel. While you're sliding down the scree, be sure to keep an eye out for golf balls, bowling balls, trash cans and various other large roll-able objects. Overall, the alternate route was not quite as scenic as Hades (proper) and required a good amount of extra effort to get through this side canyon.

See the beta from Bluugnome for complete details.

Approach

From the parking lot, walk directly west towards bad water. Once you reach the edge of the parking lot, find a comfortable way down the hill. Be sure to follow the Bluugnome waypoints to make sure toy stay on track, but generally you're heading down hill and should get funneled into the alternate canyon.

If you drop into the scree field, near the trail going to the peak, you'll find the natural pit in reddish-pink stone further downhill. Be aware this pit is surrounded by typical, terrible and crumbly Death Valley rock and it sounded like it was at least 20 ft deep.

Descent

Rap 13 (alt-rap 13) before dropping into Hades Proper: webbing was badly cut due to rubbing, so be sure to thoroughly inspect the webbing here.

Rap 8 (Hades Proper): an additional cairn was added to split this into a 90 ft and 40 ft rappel (not exact)

Rap 11 (Hades Proper): There is a 90 degree corner and a pinch that will make this pull very troublesome if you pull from inside the watercourse. If walk the rope far RDC so the rope clears the 2nd stage, the pull was not bad.

Descent Rap details from Dec. 22' Descent

  • R1 - 30ft off cairn (built)
  • R2 - 90 ft off cairn
  • R3 - 30 ft off cairn
  • R4 - 50 ft off cairn (built)
  • R5 - off cairn
  • R6 - 90 ft off cairn
  • R7 - 90 off cairn behind boulder
  • R8 - 35 ft off boulder
  • R9 - 120 ft did as 2 stage
  • R10 - 150 ft off boulder pinch
  • R11 - 20 ft off bomber cairn
  • R12 - 25 off cairn (Linked 11 and 12)
  • R13 - 40 off cairn 
  • R14 - 150 ft off cairn (11:30am)
  • R15 - 150 ft off cairn (built)
  • R16 - 120 ft off huge cairn (three stage)
  • R17 - 40 ft off embedded cairn
  • R18 - 150 ft four stage rappel around swirling water course (Five stars)
  • R19 - 150 ft off cairn (built) down huge runnel (Five stars)
  • R20 - 25 ft off cairnoff cairn 25 ft
  • Hades
  • R21 - 20 ft off fiddlestick
  • R22 - 80 ft off cairn
  • R23 - 30 ft off fiddlestick
  • R24 - 80 ft off fiddlestick 
  • R25 - 180 off wrapped Boulder
  • R26 - Spicy downclimb and then a single rusty piton (60 ft) or Boulder (150 ft)
  • R27 - 200 ft off cairn (four stage)
  • R28 - 140 ft off cairn
  • R29 - 50 ft off cairn
  • R30 - 200 ft off cairn (three stages)
  • R31 - 75 ft off two pinches
  • R32 - 145 ft off two pitons (multiple stages)
  • R33 - 60 ft off slung chockstone

Exit

Once you exit the canyon, follow one of the main washes west for a ways, but do not follow it all the way to the road because it will likely angle southwest. Instead, walk north for a few minutes up hill until you find a wash that will take you west and slightly north. You should be able to see your car once you have gone far enough north.

Red tape

Beta sites

  • BluuGnome.com : Hades Canyon Dante's Variation route

Trip reports and media

  • December 22' Descent
  • https://www.facebook.com/scott.swaney/media_set?set=a.10150197808537930.353906.668617929&type=3

EVEN FURTHER HADES CANYON

Background

properties.name: tMntPeryUseTrl
properties.description: Trailhead for the Mount Perry Use Trail. Sections of the trail are hard to follow while other sections are very worn in. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: yHadesDantesTp
properties.description: Top entry for the Hades Canyon Dante's Variation route. Chose this as and arbitrary point to mark the start of the technical canyon. The start of a mind blowing collection of trashcans and other assorted junk that has blown or been thrown off Dante's View. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: wHadesAltRP-01
properties.description: Vertical hole about 2 feet in diameter drops very deep. There is a natural rock barrier around all but one side to the hle. Be careful not to fall in. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: wHadesAltRP-02
properties.description: Drop in the wash that marks the start of a few drops that will be bypassed LDC before reaching rap 1 about 500 feet down canyon. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadeAltR1-2
properties.description: Raps 1-2 - Hades Alt Entry. Rap 1 andchored from cairn anchor and drops about 45 feet. Rap 2 anchored from cairn anchor and drops about 50 feet down slightly sloped wall. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadeAltR3
properties.description: Rap 3 - Hades Alt Entry. Anchored from a carin anchor and drops about 50 feet. Can be bypassed RDC. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadeAltR4
properties.description: Rap 4 - Hades Alt Entry. Anchored from a carin anchor and drops about 70 feet. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadeAltR5
properties.description: Rap 5 - Hades Alt Entry. Anchored from a multi colored rock embedded in the wash and drops about 75 feet. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadeAltR6
properties.description: Rap 6 - Hades Alt Entry. Anchored from rock placed in a pothole about 15 feet back from the rap and drops about 35 feet. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadeAltR7
properties.description: Rap 7 - Hades Alt Entry. Anchored from pinch point of huge boulder and canyon wall RDC about 20 feet back. Rap drops about 55 feet. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadeAltR8-9
properties.description: Raps 8-9 - Hades Alt Entry. Rap 8 andchored from single rock placed behind a bush and drops about 35 feet. Rap 9 is anchored from a rock embedded in teh wash and drops about 160 feet. Rap 9 is a fun rap. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadeAltR10-11
properties.description: Raps 10-11 - Hades Alt Entry. Rap 10 anchored from a cairn anchor and uses about 155 fet of rope as it drops over ledges along water pour offs. Rap 11 is anchored from a cairn anchor and uses about 110 feet of rope as it drops over 3 stages of 15 feet; 30 feet and 15 feet. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadeAltR12-14
properties.description: Raps 12-14 - Hades Alt Entry. Rap 12 anchored from a cairn and drops about 60 feet. Rap 13 anchored from a cairn and drops less than 100 feet down 4 stages in a narrow twisting slot. Rap 14 anchored from a cairn anchor and drops about 165 feet down a vertical wall. 07-MAR-10 1:26:59PM (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: jHadesDanteVw
properties.description: Point where the Dante's Variation alternate entry joins the main Hades Canyon. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: wHadesRP-01
properties.description: Drop of about 30 feet which is bypassed by climbing up and around slightly up canyon of the drop then down a to a short scree slope. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadesR2
properties.description: Rap 2 - Hades. Anchored from red rock sitting near the top of the rap and drops a total of about 60 feet. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadesR3-4
properties.description: Raps 3-4 - Hades. Rap 3 anchored from choke stone under foot and drops about 30 feet. Rap 4 anchored from cairn anchor and drops about 80 feet with a ledge about 10 feet down. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: wHadesRP-02
properties.description: Short 8 foot down climb then a huge boulder in the wash with a narrow section LDC to walk around the huge boulder in the wash. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadesR5-6
properties.description: Raps 5-6 - Hades. Rap 5 anchored from large rock in wash about 20 feet back then drops about 35 feet with a small pocket in the wall part way down. Rap 5 is done about 15 feet RDC of the main pour off for the drop. Rap 6 anchored from a very large rock embedded in the wash about 30 feet back. Webbing is strung from the anchor all the way to the ledge so the rope is not too short for the drop. Rap 6 drops about 180 feet from the lip down a sheer wall. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadesR7-8
properties.description: Raps 7-8 - Hades. Rap 7 anchored from large rock up a slope of rock LDC of the main wash and uses about 135 feet of rope as it drops over a series of ledges. Rap 8 anchored from a cairn anchor and uses about 175 feet of rope as it drops down a series of ledges. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadesR9-11
properties.description: Raps 9-11 - Hades. Rap 9 anchored from a cairn anchor and drops about 140 feet with a ledge about 20 feet down. Rap 10 anchored from a cairn and drops about 60 feet with a ledge about 20 feet down. Rap 11 anchored from a cairn and uses 200 feet of rope as it drops over a series of ledges. Be careful not to rap off the end of your rope. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadesR12-13
properties.description: Raps 2-13 - Hades. Rap 12 anchored from two choke stones and uses about 125 feet of rope as it drops over a series of ledges. Rap 13 anchored from two pitons and uses about 145 feet of rope as it drops over a series of ledges. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: dHadesR14
properties.description: Rap 14 - Hades. Anchored from a rock embedded in the wash and drops about 60 feet down a sloped wall. Optionally you can down climb down a slanted crevice RDC. 17-APR-10 5:29:48PM (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: yHadesBt
properties.description: Bottom exit of Hades Canyon. (Data by bluugnome.com)

properties.name: pkHadesBt
properties.description: Park a vehicle here along the highway for transportation after exiting the bottom of Hades Canyon. (Data by bluugnome.com)
